results.title: Cyberthon II: The Virtual Transmission [1-hour compiltation]
results.brief_description:
‘Cyberthon II: The Virtual Transmission’ was the second in the series of Cyberthon broadcast events. Set up from TVU’s (Television Unlimited) warehouse and studio in Footscray Victoria, it was once again broadcast live via RMITV’s frequency UHF-31. Unlike the previous Cyberthon and Cyberdelia broadcast events however, Cyberthon II: The Virtual Transmission had expanded in scope afforded by its new venue and increasing popularity of the techno scene.

Adding to the DJ, VJ sets, live performances of electronic music and art, a range of artists also performed live. Artists such as Stelarc performed his Third Arm and Craig Horsham displayed his subversive VHS crash editing of mainstream TV commercials. The Amiga Users Group exhibited a collection of Amiga demos while a diverse range of artists displayed accompanying complex visual effects and art installations.

This one-hour edit was made a year after the 24-hour event occurred.

Visual Artists: Tekno Mandala (Adem Jaffers), Cyber Dada (Dale Nason and Troy Innocent), Future Films (Jeff Jaffers), Don’t Shoot the Messenger (Steve Middleton and Attillio Gangemi), Bureau of Inverse Technology - BIT (Natalie Jeremijenko, Kate Rich and Danny Tigani), Amiga Users Group, Craig Horsham, Force Fed (Stuart McCormick & Michael Brand), Video Graffiti (Andrew Nelson)

Audio Artists: Third Eye ‘Ambi Jam’ (Gus Till, Ollie Olsen, Geoffrey Hales, Simon Polinski), Blast Off Sound System (Jason ‘Rudeboy’ Mac), Foil (Neil Boyack, Andrew Coates, Steve Law, Chris Grierson), 1x4x9 (Braden Schlager & Miles du Heaume), Magnetic Head Circuit (Chubba, Matt Bastard, Peter Randall), Tribal (Duncan Gray, Bruce Yardley & Cam Saunderson), Extroversion (Kate Armstrong), Hardware (Richie ‘Rich’ McNeil), Mystic Force (Russell Hancorne), Poets of the Machine (Koral Island & Stripe)

Performers: Stelarc, Just to fresh, Computer Graphture (Simone Millman and Tanya Hoddinott), Space Between The Gaps (Paul Gafney), Jacinta Le Plastrier, Yoga (Mary Galick, Bronwyn Richie & Paul Gafney), Zenep Jaffers

Cyberthon II: The Virtual Transmission is part of the Cyberthon Archive generously donated to ACMI by Adem Jaffers.

results.title: Titles in Analects of Kung Phu
results.description:
Aside from bareknuckle action and breakneck stunts, martial arts and wuxia films are packed with wisdom and life lessons. Artist Jason Phu has reclaimed these wise sayings and remixed them into a moving image philosophy for surviving contemporary life. Divided into chapters featuring insights and meditations from different movies, TV shows and videogames, Analects of Kung Phu: Book 1, The 69 Dialogues between the Lamp and the Shadow offers a guide to ourselves and society taught by action stars and movie heroes.

This list corresponds to the different channels in the work, with the main middle screen represented on the left and the two secondary screens to the right.

results.title: Analects of Kung Phu: Book 1, The 69 Dialogues between the Lamp and the Shadow
results.credit_line:
Jason Phu
Three-channel video installation, 85 mins.
Edited by Conor Bateman
Mordant Family Moving Image Commission, ACMI Collection
results.brief_description: During times of uncertainty, people look for guidance. Jason Phu found it in martial arts films. By reclaiming wise sayings from movies and TV shows Analects of Kung Phu presents a moving image philosophy for surviving contemporary life.

constellations_primary.name: Jason Phu annd genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_primary.description: Bold and surprising, Jason Phu’s video work presents a guide for surviving contemporary life through martial arts films and classic Chinese philosophy, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese/Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the featured films.

results.title_for_label: Analects of Kung Phu: Book 1, The 69 Dialogues between the Lamp and the Shadow
results.description:
“I want to create something that is genuinely useful but is also aware of its own representational fallacies and historical inaccuracies. I hope that people notice the highly personal nature of this work and feel inspired to make their own compendium of sayings to guide their own lives.” – Jason Phu

During times of uncertainty, people look for guidance. Jason Phu found it in martial arts films. By reclaiming wise sayings from movies and TV shows like Drunken Master (1978) and Avatar the Last Airbender (2005–08), Analects of Kung Phu presents a moving image philosophy for surviving contemporary life. Taught by action stars but inspired by classic Chinese texts like Lao Zi’s Dao De Jing, he questions whether these life lessons are genuinely useful. Phu is aware of how wisdom can be oversimplified and misused, how film subtitles miss the mark or even present a completely different narrative, and how we are guided in our day-to-day life by the movies we watch.

Leading Melbourne-based visual artist Jason Phu’s multi-disciplinary practice includes printmaking, installation, painting and video. Born in 1989 in Sydney, Australia, Phu lives and works in Melbourne, Australia. Phu’s artworks often explore Chinese histories in Australia, his own family history, and Chinese/Vietnamese folktales.

Jason Phu is the 2021 recipient of the Mordant Family Moving Image Commission for young Australian artists.

Read more

My parents met at the fish market by Jason Phu in The Lifted Brow

Interview #34 — Jason Phu by Sophia Cai in Liminal

Storytelling with Jason Phu by Sabina McKenna in Acclaim

Who is Jason Phu? by Jane Albert in Broadsheet

results.title: Bad Street Brawler for NES
results.material_description: Cartridge videogame. Cartridge, manual and blurb card in cardboard box
results.brief_description: In Bad Street Brawler, the player plays the character Duke Davis, a former punk rocker and the “world’s coolest” martial artist. Duke has to work his way through each level beating up the crooks that get in his way. Before the start of the next stage, quotes are introduced to entertain the player, such as “Never trouble trouble until trouble troubles you”. The player’s moves are limited to kicks and punches but new moves and attacks become available as the game progresses, along with new enemy types such as gorillas flinging bananas, menacing stakeboarders and circus strongmen. Bad Street Brawler is one of two games designed specifically for Mattel’s Power Glove.

results.title: Sinnui yauman (A Chinese Ghost Story)
results.creator_credit: Cinema City Co, Film Workshop, Tsui Hark and Ching Siu-tung
results.brief_description: Leslie Cheung stars as Ning Tsai-Shen, a timid tax collector who happens upon the haunted Lan Ro temple where he meets and falls in love with Nieh Hsiao-Tsing a restless ghost (Joey Wong) whose soul is being held captive by a hideous tree demon.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu annd genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Bold and surprising, Jason Phu’s video work presents a guide for surviving contemporary life through martial arts films and classic Chinese philosophy, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese/Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the featured films.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Cinema City Co, Film Workshop, Tsui Hark and Ching Siu-tung
results.description: Leslie Cheung (Happy Together) stars as Ning Tsai-Shen, a timid tax collector who happens upon the haunted Lan Ro temple where he meets and falls in love with Nieh Hsiao-Tsing a restless ghost (Joey Wong) whose soul is being held captive by a hideous tree demon. Enlisting the help of a mysterious Taoist monk (Wu Ma), the young tax collector tries to free the girl’s spirit and lay it to rest before her eminent marriage to the evil mountain demon. Employing rapid editing, surreal imagery (including a demon with a giant killer tongue) and spectacular fight sequences, ‘A Chinese ghost story’ is a fine example of the kinetic energy and outlandish sensibility that is a staple of the Hong Kong fantasy genre. Also starring Joi Wang. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
results.creator_credit: Sony Pictures, Columbia Pictures, Good Machine International, EDKO Film, Zoom Hunt International, China Films Co-Production, Asian Union Film and Entertainment, Bill Kong, Ligong Xu and Ang Lee
results.brief_description: An epic love story and action drama set in China during the Qing dynasty, revolving around two sets of lovers. Li Mu Bai and Yu Shu Lien are duty bound warriors whose unspoken love spans decades. By comparison, their young romantic counterparts Jen Yu and Lo represent freedom, youth and unrestrained love.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu annd genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Bold and surprising, Jason Phu’s video work presents a guide for surviving contemporary life through martial arts films and classic Chinese philosophy, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese/Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the featured films.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Sony Pictures, Columbia Pictures, Good Machine International, EDKO Film, Zoom Hunt International, China Films Co-Production, Asian Union Film and Entertainment, Bill Kong, Ligong Xu and Ang Lee
results.description: An epic love story and action drama, set in China during the Qing dynasty, revolving around two sets of lovers. Li Mu Bai (Chow Yun Fat) and Yu Shu Lien (Michelle Yeoh) are cast as duty bound warriors whose unspoken love for each other spans decades. By comparison, their young romantic counterparts Jen Yu (a promising young warrior) and Lo (her bandit lover) represent freedom, youth and unrestrained love. After Li surrenders his legendary sword to Yu and vows to stop fighting, his plans to retire are halted when the sword is stolen. In their quest to recover it, Li and Yu confront the evil forces headed by Jade Fox who is attempting to recruit the impressionable young Jen Yu to her cause. As the opposing forces of good and evil battle to secure the sword, they also struggle to lure Jen Lu to their side. Based on an early 20th century novel by Wang Du Lu, the project was scripted by Wang Hui Ling, James Schamus and Tsai Kuo Jung. Photographed by Peter Pau. Martial arts choreography by Yuen Wo-Ping. (Awards: Academy Awards 2001, Best Foreign Film, Best Music Score, Best Art Direction and Best Cinematography)

results.title: Police Story 3: Super Cop
results.creator_credit: Golden Harvest, Golden Way, Leonard Ho, Raymond Chow and Stanley Tong
results.brief_description: Jackie Chan is the maverick cop Ka Kui who goes undercover to investigate covert arms and drug deals between mainland China and Hong Kong. Michelle Yeoh plays his partner Yeung and together they embark on an action-packed adventure which is full of amazing stunts and daredevil feats.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu annd genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Bold and surprising, Jason Phu’s video work presents a guide for surviving contemporary life through martial arts films and classic Chinese philosophy, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese/Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the featured films.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Golden Harvest, Golden Way, Leonard Ho, Raymond Chow and Stanley Tong
results.description: Chan Kong-sang, or as westerners know him, “Jackie Chan”, is the maverick cop Ka Kui who goes undercover to investigate covert arms and drug deals between mainland China and Hong Kong. Michelle Yeoh plays his partner Yeung and together they embark on an action-packed adventure which is full of amazing stunts and daredevil feats that will leave you on the edge of your seat. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Drunken Master
results.creator_credit: Seasonal Film Corporation, Zhang Quan and Yuen Woo-Ping
results.brief_description: This 1978 Hong Kong film, one of the earliest to star Jackie Chan, highlights the relationship between a student and his martial arts master.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu annd genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Bold and surprising, Jason Phu’s video work presents a guide for surviving contemporary life through martial arts films and classic Chinese philosophy, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese/Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the featured films.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Seasonal Film Corporation, Zhang Quan and Yuen Woo-Ping
results.description: This 1978 Hong Kong film, one of the earliest to star Jackie Chan, highlights the relationship between a student and his martial arts master. Wong Fei Hung, played by Chan, is a 19th Century folk hero in Chinese culture and cinema, a master of kung fu who fights the injustice of British colonialism (this character would later be portrayed by Jet Li in ‘Once upon a time in China’). Drunken Master finds Wong in his early years as a troublesome fighter who is sent to his uncle, the hard-drinking title character, for instruction in discipline and martial arts. After enduring torturous training, Wong runs away only to encounter some local villains. Being badly beaten, he returns to his uncle who finally trains him in “drunken style” kung fu. Cast includes: Jackie Chan, Simon Yuen and Lam Yin.

results.title: Reach for the Stars for PC
results.creator_credit: Strategic Simulations, Inc. and Strategic Studies Group
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM, CD case insert, CD jewel case, licence agreement and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description: Reach for the Stars is a re-released and updated version of the DOS era game of the same name, the earliest example of a game in the 4X genre. The player starts off in a single planetary system and must eventually create and run an interstellar empire. In typical 4X style, this is done by exploring the universe around the player, expanding by claiming new territory, exploiting any resources in the area and exterminating any opponents along the way. The re-release features updated graphics and new scenarios for the player.

results.title: Play It Again II: Games Collection
results.brief_description:
The Play It Again II project aims to document, preserve, and create an accessible and playable history of Australasian videogames and videogame culture from the 1990’s.

This collection comprises physical games and hardware donated to ACMI for the project and as well as game emulation files created by ACMI or harvested from external web repositories.

The project is being undertaken by ACMI in partnership with Swinburne University, RMIT, AARNet, UNESCO PERSIST and OpenSLX GmbHt.
This project is supported by the Australian Government through the Australian Research Council Linkage Program. Play It Again II is a continuation of Play It Again I, which focused on the preservation of Australasian videogames from the 1980’s.
